title: Three arrested following brawl at Division III basketball game
text:
Three arrested following brawl at Division III basketball game For a school terminating its basketball program, this was one heck of a way to go out. — Jim Weber (@JimMWeber) February 19, 2017 
Daniel Webster College is shuttering its Division III basketball program at the end of the 2016-17 season, which they closed out with a 2-0 forfeit after one of their players punched a Southern Vermont player in the head. Nashua, New Hampshire police ended up making three arrest related to the incident. 
From D3Hoops.com : 
Marquise Caudill leveled a member of the Southern Vermont team, who appears to be Kyle DePollar. After the brawl which ensued, Caudill was charged with second degree assault, disorderly conduct and criminal threatening for threatening a member of the Nashua, N.H., police department working security at the game, and disorderly conduct. Teammate Antwaun Boyd was charged with disorderly conduct as well, for appearing to incite the crowd. A bystander, Elizabeth Morris, was charged with obstruction of government administration for trying to keep officers from arresting Caudill. Icy helmet designs for each NFL team Start SlideShow 
The game, which was stopped with 14:34 to go in the second half, officially goes into the books as a 2-0 win for Southern Vermont, a rare occasion of a forfeit rather than a no-contest. Caudill was the team's leading scorer, at 13.7 points per game. Author
